RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZILLION was allowed to settle early on the inside, shifted out by the three eighths marker, made a three wide move and continued that move leaving the turn and drew clear in the furlong grounds to prove much the best, driving. LILTONYTWOPHONES set the pace on the inside and drew clear on the turn, then was headed leaving the furlong marker and was no match for the winner, second best. SPOOKY ONE tracked the pace three wide, then chased the pace two wide on the turn and weakened, bested rest. EGOT A POKER FACE chased the pace on the inside and weakened. KEEPING IT COUNTRY showed good early speed two wide and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Zillion
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, shift out 3/8, 3 wide move, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Liltonytwophones
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, drew clear turn, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Keeping It Country
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Egot a Poker Face
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Spooky One
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, 2 wide turn, weakened, bested rest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 93. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 17 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DR. STEVE set the pace along the inside and drew clear on the turn, widened the margin leaving the turn and then was kept to left handed crop urging to prove much the best. GRAB THE GOLD tracked the early pace on the inside, chased the pace on the turn and held the place award late. STRIKING MOON was rated early and was two wide on the turn, blocked nearing the quarter pole, shifted out four wide leaving the trun fir racing room, then finished willingly to just miss the place award. DYNAMITE KARMA stumbled at the start, chased the pace between rivals, then was four wide on the turn and came five wide into the lane and had no rally. READY AND RICH chased tyhe pace five wide and had no rally. KHAKI JACK stalked the early pace and then chased the winner three wide on the turn and weakened. TOMMY THE TORCH failed to menace. COUSTEAU chased the pace on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Dr. Steve
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrone Stephen E Kimball Dan and Spendolini John
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, drew clear turn, drew off, driving,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. Stephen Morrone, Dan Kimball & JohnSpendolini

ENTRY.NAME: Grab the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, chased inside turn, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Cousteau
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 2 wide, blocked 1/4, shift 4 wide upper, finished willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamite Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, chased between rivals, 4 wide turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy the Torch
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Khaki Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, chased 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Ready and Rich
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 5 wide, wide turn, came 6 wide, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 74. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR UPTOWN GIRL was rated along the inside early, split rivals nearing the five sixteenths, made a three wide bid nearing the quarter pole and drew off in the lane to prove best, driving. BEACH BANKER set the pace while in the two path, then was headed leaving the turn and was no match for the winner while staying on to be clearly second best. MORE RANSOM was allowed to settle early, angled out in the stretch and finished well for the show award while no threat to the top two. DENALI RAE tracked the pace three wide and weakened. SNAPPY RIDE hopped at the start, reserved early and lacked a solid rally. UNION RALLY tracked the pace four wide and weakened. PURELY SILVER showed speed on the inside and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Purely Silver
ENTRY.OWNER: Wagon Wheel Farm and Farrell Brenda
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Beach Banker
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2 wide, headed upper stretch, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Denali Rae
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Union Rally
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 4 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Snappy Ride
ENTRY.OWNER: Indian Mills Stock Farm and DNA Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, reserved early, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: More Ransom
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, angled out stretch, up for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Our Uptown Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Uptowncharlybrown Stud LLC and Whiskey Run Stables LLc
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, split 5/16, bid 3 wide, drew off, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since January 17 Allowed 2 lb s. Such A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BACK RING LUCK was four wide into the first turn, vied for the lead on the outside, made a three wide bid on the turn and slowly edged clear leaving the furlong marker to prove best, driving. MIDNIGHT ACT was five wide into the first turn, tracked the pace four wide and finished willingly to get the place award. MOON WARRIOR was well placed on the inside, eased off the inside on the turn and then shifted out in the stretch but was in traffic leaving the furlong marker and ran on to just miss the place award. MY MAN POTS N PANS vied for the lead between rivals on the turn, then dueled for the lead on the inside on the far turn, weakened the final furlong. P JS SILVER DUKE was reserved on the inside and had no solid rally. YES SIR COLONEL lunged at the start, made a five wide middle move and weakened. COOL COMEDIAN vied for the lead on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: P Js Silver Duke
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, saved ground turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, eased out 1/4, traffic stretch, missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Cool Comedian
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: My Man Pots N Pans
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between horses, dueled inside turn, weakened 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Back Ring Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, vied outside, bid 3 wide, edged clear, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Yes Sir Colonel
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged start, middle move 5 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, tracked pace 4 wide, came 4 wide, up for 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONCE A GIANT was allowed to settle early, between rivals on the backstretch, advanced four wide on the turn and came five wide into the lane, closed well to get up late to prove best, driving. BOSSY CAT was five wide into the first turn, rated along four wide and made a four wide bid on the turn to take over leaving the turn but was caught late. LONG TOM was rated along the inside, eased out on the turn and came three wide into the lane, lacked room in the lane and did run on in traffic, rough trip. SOUPER EMPEROR prompted the pace four wide and made a three wide bid on the turn to vie for command but faded the final furlong. MR BOLDACIOUS was reserved on the inside, angled out in the lane and had a late rally. JUMP FREE pressed the pace and made a bid between rivals and then weakened. TUCKABUCKAWAY was settled back early, advanced wide on the turn and then was empty in the drive. WINNERS WIN lacked a solid rally. PEAKY BLINKERS set a pressured pace on the inside and then vied for command by the half mile marker and checked by the quarter pole and weakened. PRINCIPALITY chased the early pace and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Peaky Blinkers
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, vied inside, checked 1/4, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Long Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, eased out turn, blocked stretch, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Jump Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, bid between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Principality
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Boldacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, angled out stretch, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Souper Emperor
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 4 wide, bid 3 wide, faded 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Once a Giant
ENTRY.OWNER: On The Rise Again Stable and Our Blue Streaks Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, between 1/2, came 5 wide, closed, up late

ENTRY.NAME: Winners Win
ENTRY.OWNER: Nikki Horses Racing and Fanelli John
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Bossy Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, rated 4 wide, bid 4 wide, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Tuckabuckaway
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, wide rally turn, empty stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALWAJD was rated along four wide, made a three wide move on the turn to take over and be clear by the quarter pole, then drew off in the lane to prove much the best, driving. INTRO was allowed to settle early, made a four wide move on the turn but could not gain on the winner, second best. DUST BUNNY was well placed early on the inside, then made a three wide bid on the turn but weakened, bested rest. LET'S GO MO chased the pace on the inside and tired. GOLDEN PHASE pressed the pace three wide and stopped. SGT RECKLESS USMC set a pressured pace on the inside and then was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Go Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Dust Bunny
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Davis Kelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, bid 3 wide turn, flattened out, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Sgt Reckless USMC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Phase
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Fountain Springs Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Alwajd
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 4 wide, bid 3 wide, drew off, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Intro
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide move turn, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 17. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CANOOCHEE was reserved early, shifted out and made a four wide move on the turn and drew off to prove much the best while being ridden out. FLOWER'S FORTUNE was rated along early, shifted out and was four wide on the turn and proved to be no match for the winner while clearly second best. IMAGINE THE MOJO was settled early, lacked a solid rally and was along for the show award. SMOKIN CLASS pressed the pace three to two wide and weakened. JUSTIN TIME was four wide into the first turn, made a four wide middle move and then tired. HAY BUCK set a pressured pace on the inside and gave way. PRIDE IN THE BIZ stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Hay Buck
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Flower's Fortune
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early, 4 wide 1/4 pole, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Imagine the Mojo
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally, along for show

ENTRY.NAME: Pride in the Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Class
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3-2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Canoochee
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 4 wide move, drew off, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Justin Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, middle move 3 wide, tired
